reviewText:
Had a blast with this over the weekend with some of my family. I make a priority to get couch games for when we're together, I have to say that this is one of our new favorites.

The kids couldn't get enough of it(My played time is off, we put way more hours into it over the weekend). Usually I get to a point where its time to move on to the next local game for us to play.. I didn't with this one.

The mechanics of the game feel well balanced, I love all of the strategies you can implement to knock out your opponents. The dodge/catch mechanic works extremely well, there wasn't a time where I felt I was cheated. If I got hit, it was my own fault.

The game has a story mode that can be played with another player, and has unlockable characters. There are a few levels, but each of them feel fresh with the different themes and obstacles to avoid. I'd love more of them, but for now I'm content with whats there. Customizeable rules help to keep things interesting as well.

All in all I feel its a great game, especially at its price point. I know this will be the first game played on the next weekend we have together, and likely many more to come.

reviewText:
A Dodgeball Arena Adventure Gamehttps://youtu.be/ITnxXAePbfc
+ Great humerus cutscenes with a silly story
+ Amazing visual style, everything looks fantastic
+ Amusing characters
+ The gameplay is pretty simple but a lot of fun with a wee bit of skill involved
+ Local Multiplayer (which definitely strengthens the game if you have someone to play with)
+ Interesting challenge / boss stages that mixes up the gameplay a bit
+ Great silly soundtrack

- The content is limited a bit, I would have liked to see a larger variety of game modes, and perhaps some more mechanics to make the gameplay a bit more intuitive. It's more or less a fun co-op game to play for a short while with friends.

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2QvIoE5xT0s
OMG what is this game? It's bizarre love it :)
It's a 1970's style dodgeball game, with boss fights, random items and laughs galore. From the moment the devil kidnapped a dodgeball player I knew I was in for a bizarre gaming experience.

The basic game is a simple dodgeball based game set on a circular court but when you start to add random items, different arenas and even boss battles into the mix it turns out to be anything but a simple dodgeball game.

Overall a fast paced dodgeball game that will have you stitches with its unusually quirky sense of humor.

+ Multiple Arenas
+ Boss Battles
+ Bonus items to throw at opponents during matches
+ Great 70's comedy feel to it, feels like a seedy 70's porno.
+ Coop and Vs Modes.

- No online multiplayer, local coop and vs only
- Scandanavian coice over only.

reviewText:
Posting a review for once to try and balance out the unfair negative reviews this game has. Almost every negative review is about it not having online play - so buyer beware, there's no online play!

That aside, the game is then very good fun, especially with a friend to play the story with. Short but sweet, and the local multiplayer is a lot of fun, with or without bots. If you're buying a game for its online multiplayer, maybe you sould check it has that feature first.

If anyone has specific questions, please do comment and I should see the notification and reply, but either way - don't be taken in by the negative reviews. It's great. Local only, fine. But great.

reviewText: StikBold is a fun retostyled game, I had a blast doing the co-op storeymode, but where the game really shines through is the local multiplayer smash up !! rarely have I been this entertained while at the same time harrassed or destroying my friends since Towerfall. reviewText: Don't believe those negative reviews, those people are only flaming that the game doesn't offer online multiplayer. The game doesn't advertise multiplayer over the internet, so it is not even a scam or something like that. Anyway, Stikbold is truly a gem and this is why.\nIt is really well made. The game mechanics work flawlessly and really smooth. The game idea is pretty simple, since you play Dodgeball but it is addicting, really. You can either play with a real life friend at your house or have a CPU player as a partner which works fine. I was surprised that a sports game like this would have a story and I really enjoy it so far. It is probably only taking 90 minutes or so, but the presentation is just really neat. The great silly humor really entertains you and you are motivated to play through the whole story. You encounter a lot of funny stuff on your way to completion and after that you still have the possibility to play with your buddies together (local, of course). Another pleasant thing is the soundtrack. It is flok-ish and is really nice to listen to. Reminds me of Tiny and Big: Grandpa's Leftovers. The soundtrack varies and each stage has its own song, which is a completely new one. There are probably 16-20 stages, will edit it as soon as I am through (currently 47% after 50 minutes).

reviewText:
A simple dodgeball arena game. Decent music and graphics, colorful world and uses the blocky human style similar to games like Minecraft and Thirty Flights of Loving. A decent lighthearted nonsensical story and voices are only in (although subtitles are available for multiple languages).

Rules are pretty simple: Game starts with the single ball dropping in the center of the arena. You can throw, pass, dodge, or catch the ball. You can also do a melee shove to make an opponent drop the ball. Two hits within a couple seconds knocks you out (permanently in harder modes or until your partner revives you in easier modes). And there are often random objects in the environment that can be thrown (only for the first hit; the ball is needed for the second hit).

The campaign is 12 missions with three optional challenges per mission (such as eliminating an opponent with a curving long shot). While the first-to-three regular dodgeball matches were fine, I had more fun with the bosses (which are less dodgeball and more action game). The AI companion is good enough as medium-skill partner (it almost always passes the ball to you to make the shot and can dodge decently) but it's not good enough to handle the harder AI or well coordinated humans. Sometimes it'll make a terrible mistake and randomly get knocked out or pass the ball to the enemy but I've made mistakes just as bad. Just don't rely on it and treat it as an extra life/a ball collector.

In the higher difficulties you have to keep your eye out for incoming projectiles and use your dodge roll perfectly. Otherwise the enemy will just hit you once your roll ends. It can just become a series of throws into catches/dodges until one side gets a lucky hit.

While I had my x360 controller plugged in, it became the sole method of control. No option to switch controls. While fine for me (I don't keep my controller plugged in all the time), may be annoying for those who do. Controls are remappable for keyboard but not controller. The diagram showing controller controls didn't show the pass button (RB for me).

Unfortunately, there is only local coop (no online multiplayer). At least you can do the campaign as coop.

Some things I'd like to have:
Better outlined text. Sometimes the font blends together and is hard to read (Especially the red team victory screen)
Actual volume sliders instead of having to cycle through all options to lower the volume
An option to constrain the mouse cursor to the window in windowed mode
An option to automatically pause the game when it goes out of focus
To be able to toggle challenge descriptions instead of it disappearing and reappearing every few seconds. Makes it a little annoying to read. Or the descriptions could be separate from the flower showing if you already completed the challenge.
While playing I saw some visual bugs but nothing too severe. There were some model clipping issues in cutscenes and a random scratch line across the dialogue box. Thought the scratch might have been on my actual screen but it followed the window when I moved it.

Worth a look if arcadey/gamey dodgeball interests you and you don't mind the presentation/silly theme. It allows you to skip cutscenes (hold space on keyboard) if you find the story/characters grating.

reviewText:
I got this game in a Humble Montly bundle, I didnt get on the store page and look at the videos or anything, heres a rundown of my first 20 minutes or so.

Boot up the game and greeted with some menus to pick text language and some other stuff I believe, then greeted with some cutesy bright block characters and areas. At first look this seems to be a game about some guys that are semi-pro dodgeball players, you do a little warm-up round to learn the controls (which are very easy to use, I've been playing with the steam controller and it's a ton of fun) After the little training session two females walk into the gym, one of your characters has the hots for one of them, you learn he gave up the win to her team last season. After this, everything starts to get more and more bizarre. First the female love interest is stolen by the devil, then you fight hippies that (I'm assuming) have made some sort of hash-honey, and during this fight thir van is driving around hitting everyone, theres bees, all hell breaks loose. I laughed until I cried and then cried more because I got ran over and killed by the honey hippies.

I'll just leave it at that. The game just gets crazier and more ridiculous as it goes along. I'm not even half done with the game and I'm blown away by every match.


Only downside to the game is there is no online multiplayer.
I'd pay $10+ for a sequel with online multiplayer.

reviewText:
Hey, I'm Emperor Maciek. I decided to do some video game reviews. Since everyone is doing it I figured it is a fun way to compare experiences.

Here is my review after first 30 minutes of play.

Graphics: 8 - Cartoony but perfectly fitting this sort of goofy/cartoony game.

Sound: 7 - Soudtrack is pretty decent so far, the voice acting is quirky but well done. The sound effects could use a bit more variation but it hasn't yet ruined the expeirence.

Controls: 9 - Responsive, So far I only used the wired Xbox360 controller, not the mouse and keyboard or two player (a person on each)

Fun Factor: 8 - So far the game is fun, has a nice storyline and doesn't take itself all too seriously. The feel matches the graphics and sound so I would recommend playing it.

I will return to review after I finish the game for a full review.

Enjoy

reviewText: Stikbold is a very casual, simple and plain game. Sure it has its own charm with the artstyle (which I personally disliked) and humor, but it gets old quickly. The game is fun for a few hours and then it gets old, granted it might be more fun to play in co-op which I didn’t try. To play in co-op you need at least 1 extra controller and up to 3 controllers for even more players. Still, this doesn’t seem like a type of game a group of adults would choose to play. Stikbold looks like it was made for families and youth to enjoy in a casual setting. So unless you are in one of those 2 demographics, I wouldn’t recommend this game. For me it just didn’t stick.

reviewText: Actually a very decent game. The campaign, although short, is really interesting and levels are unique. The levels aren't too difficult, but they can be if you increase the difficulty and want to complete all the challenges. The mechanics are simple but fun and the visuals are very pleasant to the eye. However the game was meant for consoles and it shows. The game doesn't  have online multiplayer and I can't see how local multiplayer would work if you don't have a controller. I would recommend the game if you have a controller and want something to play with friends.  The AI isn't very helpful either if you want to play the campaign alone.

reviewText:
Video Review:
https://youtu.be/9Uh3EW24pbg

Greetings fellow gamers!
This is Gamer Guy (In a Suit) back with a review for a BRAND NEW Indie game that's just amazingly hilarious, Stikbold!

Stikbold is essentially an indie game with a 70's-era Dodgeball feel to it. Yeah. Dodgeball. It's even officially endorsed. The game provides both a Quick Match mode, and a Story Mode. Stikbold can be played solo, but it's best played as a local co-op. This is buddy-game playing at it's finest. The story is quite funny and charming, and the music is downright funky. The gameplay is clearly desinged around a controller, although a mouse and keyboard can be used. I would suggest using a controller. The Steam Contoller works flawlessly with this, as does my Logitech. By completeing parts of the story mode (and it's various challenges!), you can unlock new players to use in the Quick Match mode of the game. QUick Match boasts two modes, one being Teams and the other being an all out Free-For-All. THese are more dodgeball related than the actual Story mode, which integrates some gameplay as well (battling a whale, dodging a VW Bus, etc)

Positives:
+ Delightfully cheerful and funny
+ Fantastic little game for hanging with a friend
+ Incredibly smooth and easy gameplay. Quick to pick up.
+ Great Soundtrack

Negatives:
- Solo is fun, but gets boring after the Story Mode is complete. A lot rides on MP.

I couldn't find much wrong with this little indie game. It is fun, and even made my friend that's NOT a gamer in any way give it a try and he quite enjoyed it. I'm positive you will too.It's worth about $10, and you can grab it now at 20% off. It's worth it.

Verdict:
7/10

Happy Gaming!

reviewText: At first I tried this game with the keyboard, In my opinion it was very hard to learn.. After a while I stoppedd and the next day I played this game with my brother with ps3 controllers. We had a lot of fun and we laughed a lot. The game has a story mode that you can play with somebody else locally or you can play it solo. In this story mode you can win new levels (maps) and new characters. The maps are really different from each other and each map adds a lot of aspect to the game. For example if you die and other people are still playing, you are still playing from the sideline for example you can throw a beach ball once in a while etc. So it's not like you are spectating the game, you are still participating. The graphics are great and I had no issues with lag.\nI have only played it for 2 hours upto this point, but the first look and start is really great!

reviewText: If you are looking for local multiplayer, then look no further. This is easily the best of its kind on Steam. This is the most epic fun I've had in ages. Grab a few gamepads, kick back on the couch and get ready for some hilarious fun. The co-op adventure mode is really funny and the difficulty is just right. The characters are really funny and the unlocks are perfect too. Just wish there was more content. Anyway, you're going to absolutely love this!

reviewText:
Such a quirkly little game that feels incredibly polished and has a crazy story with refined gameplay (what a mouthful!)

I played this with my friend at Eurogamer 2015 and the developers were all awesome friendly people, and it was easily one of the most fun games we played whilst there. I definitely think it's more fun if you have a friend or sibling to play through it with, but the solo experience is still fun in itself!

For £8, I can't think of many other games you'll get this amount of fun from.

reviewText: Note: I was given an advance key in order to play this game on my YouTube channel ALT PLAY.\n\nA silly take on the very serious sport of dodgeball, Stikbold! is a great battle game meant for local play. The game features control with keyboard and mouse as well as controller support, a plus for any who prefer to use twinsticks to move and aim. I was engaged throughout the entire story mode and can't wait to play this mode again with friends in co-op. The difficulty ramps very quickly and also provides a proper challenge through bosses with different methods for defeating them and achievements to obtain in every level. Definitely a great game to experience.

reviewText:
Fun concept, but the game runs into a bunch of bad design decisions on the mega coach fight if you are playing story mode solo:

1) Bad AI partner that gets downed constantly
2) Infinitely spawning enemies
3) Too much boss time" where the boss cannot be hit
4) "Friendly fire" where the idiot AI partner will constantly take you out

The frustration that came from this stage is a massive difficulty spike and enough to make me not want to come back to this game."

reviewText:
I love dodgeball. I'm one of the few nerdy, fat, bullied kids who loved playing dodgeball in gym class. I took it as the only oportunity I had to hurt and humiliate the popular kids who made my life a living hell. I have good memories, and have always wanted to play a good dodgeball video game.

Mechanics are solid, this is not the dodgeball I know as you can run around freely across the playing are instead of being confined to your team's space. This allows you to not only dodge the incoming fire, but also tackle opposing players and steal the ball. (maybe this is a European version of the rules, or something the game made up on its own) Not a huge fan of the mechanics, but it is still the dodgeball I love.

My problem is the annoying aesthetics. The character models are ugly, the story is dumb, and there's just something off about the whole package. I love colorful and quirky aesthetics a lot, but this game is really rubbing me the wrong way with its approach. This might be truly subjective, but I really dislike this game. If you want to play another cutsy, quirky game play Roundabout.

Goofy and cute, this dodgeball game is great accessible fun for a couple of hours.

---

The game has a brief campaign with multiple difficulty settings and each mission has challenges to complete within it. It has LOCAL MULTIPLAYER ONLY.

I thought it was very charming and decently challenging on the higher difficulties.

reviewText: NOTE DEVELOPER GAVE KEY BUT IT DOESN'T MEAN THAT I'M GOING TO SUGAR COAT THIS REVEIW\n\nWhen i got this game, i wasn't to sure the trailer didn't really excite me, so when day I was bored, and I decided to play this game, and boy was I wrong this game is FANTASTIC. Now it does have its flaws, and you might want to configure your controls (i had to configure the curve because C to curve was not working out for me) but other than that, you can tell it was made by Russians? (I don't know the accent, but i can tell it wasn't American.) Now i don't mind the culture of the developer, but I think he/her/them should get some dubbed actors. It's kind of sad for me to having to read during the cutscenes although, it's not that big of a deal. Now the cons are awesome, I am on a Toshba windows 10 and the graphics are amazing for this game, and i'm surprised my PC can run it in High Quality. The gameplay is pretty awesome, the characters are kind of annoying but it doesn't really matter. It's kind of a goofy game in my opinion, it doesn't have real competive wish is what i think was the dev's intention. It would be awesome if the dev had some kind online multiplayer so I can get my freinds to buy the game, when we have game night we are bored out of our minds by the same games, so this would give us another variety. This reveiw probably makes no sense mostly because I'm making it when I just woke up XD, but i hope this helps.
